item.title: Michelle add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Life's single lesson: that there is more accident to it than a man can ever admit to in a lifetime and stay sane." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Michelle add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Brevity is the soul of lingerie." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Hal Borland
item.description: "No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn." -- Hal Borland

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "I read a book one day and my whole life was changed." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "I was 32 when I started cooking; up until then, I just ate." -- Julia Child

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Paul Klee
item.description: "One eye sees, the other feels." -- Paul Klee

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Chris Abani
item.description: "What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion." -- Chris Abani

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Like all of my friends, she's a lousy judge of character." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ira Glass
item.description: "We live in a world where joy and empathy and pleasure are all around us, there for the noticing." -- Ira Glass

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oliver Sacks
item.description: "Every act of perception, is to some degree an act of creation, and every act of memory is to some degree an act of imagination." -- Oliver Sacks
